headline: Explainer on barring Kneecap
quote: Canada stands firmly against hate speach [...] and the glorification of terrorism
summary: Announces Irish group Kneecap won’t be allowed in, citing 'antisemitic' statements presented as anti-Israel criticism.
commentary: Frames criticism of Israel as antisemitism and advances a prohibition on expression. Treats anti-Zionist speech as hate while ignoring comparable dehumanizing speech about Palestinians. Raises serious free-expression and equal-treatment concerns.

headline: Reposted PM statement on East Jerusalem attack
quote: Canada condemns the terrorist attack in East Jerusalem today that has taken civilian lives and injured so many...
summary: Amplifies the Prime Minister’s statement condemning violence against Israelis.
commentary: Highlights Israeli victims while omitting parallel acknowledgment of Palestinian civilian deaths and international findings on unlawful conduct. Reinforces a one-sided moral frame.

headline: Two-state solution video
quote: Two-state solution is only possible when Israel can have peace and security beside a viable Palestinian state.
summary: Presents two-state as contingent on Israeli security, without addressing proportionality or accountability for Palestinian civilian harm.
commentary: Security-first framing centers the occupying power’s preferences and avoids any concrete accountability for ongoing mass civilian casualties.

headline: Shares PM statement on antisemitic assault in Ottawa
quote: We stand with you against hate and threats to your safety, and we will act to confront antisemitism wherever it appears.
summary: Publishes the PM’s statement about an assault on a Jewish woman in an Ottawa grocery store; expresses support for the Jewish community and law enforcement.
commentary: Condemning antisemitism is necessary; however, his record shows no comparable urgency for Palestinians facing hate or grief in Canada, nor for Palestinian civilians abroad. The asymmetry functions politically.

headline: Letter to Mayor Valérie Plante
quote: Please find my letter to Mayor @val_plante regarding the rise of Antisemitism in Montreal.
summary: Publishes a letter to Montréal’s mayor about antisemitism.
commentary: Focuses exclusively on antisemitism while omitting anti-Palestinian racism and the chilling of advocacy for Palestinian rights. Continues the pattern of selective concern.

headline: Please see my full statement…
quote: Please see my full statement on Prime Minister Mark Carney’s intention to recognize a Palestinian state above.
summary: Posts a 'full statement' setting conditions around recognizing a Palestinian state.
commentary: Treats Palestinian rights as conditional while leaving Israeli state accountability unaddressed. Normalizes unequal standards.

headline: Visited the Nova Exhibit
quote: Alongside Prime Minister @markjcarney and my colleague @leslie.church, I visited the Nova Exhibit again today... I encourage as many people as possible to attend the @novaexhibition...
summary: Encourages attendance at the Nova Exhibit memorializing Oct 7.
commentary: Reiterates Oct 7 atrocities while providing no acknowledgment of Palestinians killed since. Maintains a narrative that erases Palestinian suffering.

headline: Walk with Israel post
quote: Once again I joined the @ujafederation Walk with Israel, the largest annual gathering of the Jewish community in Canada.
summary: Participates in UJA’s Walk with Israel event.
commentary: Public alignment with a pro-Israel mobilization during a period of mass Palestinian civilian deaths. No balancing recognition of Palestinian lives or rights.
